column1: nice line to launch the innings, fading into the left-hander and ghosting past the edge
touch wider this time, back of a length, he watches it go by

first runs. They're off the pad. Starc goes fuller this time, probably looking to shape this away from a middle stump line, but that goes down leg with his angle and past Tamim's flick for a tickle off the pads
full, a shade wide outside off, he puts in a nervous stride and gets this down to third man off the outside half of the bat

ooooh yes. Ambitious from Sarkar first up. Pushes away from the body and looks to drive this length ball on the up, but it nips back sharply from outside off and flies over his off stump via the big gap
beats him on the inside edge once more. This is a yorker, just outside off stump. Sarkar tries to jam this to third man, but there's no feet from him again
a shout for lbw, turned down. Tamim prods at this length ball with half a stride, and he's struck on the flap outside off. Going over
nice. Back of a length, off stump, and cutting away sharply as Tamim looks to poke at this off the back foot. Well beaten
full and straightening at leg stump, beats him for pace on the flick, ball dribbles away behind square off the pad
length, off stump, slight slant away from the left-hander who is behind this to defend off the back foot
good length, off stump, soft-handed forward block into the off side
good length, angled across off stump, goes back to this and leaves his off stump exposed as he defends away from the body
full, aimed for off stump. Tamim is late on this with a half-stride, digs it into the pitch as he looks to drive with a full face
good length, in the channel. Tamim's most confident stride of the day comes out this time, but he can't time this drive well enough to beat mid-off
back of a length at middle, gets on his toes and drops this into the leg side with a closed face

a big stare from the big fast bowler. He's hit Tamim on the glove with a bouncer. The batsman is late on this, but he's got his bat up awkwardly even as he's trying to get inside the line. Thankfully for him, this doesn't lob up to the slips
a yorker, just outside off stump, slight movement in, Tamim is happy to let it go
back of a length at off stump, solidly behind the line to defend this back down the pitch
back of a length in the corridor, nervous poke into the off side off the back foot
good length, angled away from Sarkar, who opens the face to stab this down to third man to get off the mark
enough, says Tamim. Down the track before Hazlewood lets this go, and sufficiently leg side of this length ball to hammer a flat-batted zinger on the up past his partner
back of a length at middle, gets behind it and drops it into the leg side
full at off stump, forward defence with a slightly open face, straight to point
back of a length and at the hips, Sarkar waits and whips this past square leg. Some momentum for the batting team at last
144kph, good length, tailing inwards, but Tamim defends comfortably on the back foot

full at middle stump, Tamim goes for the drive with hard hands. Skews it off the inside half, but gets it wide of Cummins at mid-on who gives chase, puts in a slide...and awkwardly stops short of the boundary. Dry outfield? For now.
short and wide from Starc, Tamim won't take the bait
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot to point
full, straight, middle stump. Tamim watches it closely and flicks nicely to find square leg
goes after the wide one this time. It's short and he is behind it quickly to cut this into the floor and over point

oh loud shout. Hazlewood strikes Sarkar plumb in front of middle stump on the back leg, but Nigel Llong says not out. Good call, that pitched outside. It was an aimless poke from Sarkar, across the line, he doesn't look comfortable

well, this was coming. Length ball, pushes across the batsman in the corridor. No feet from him again, a lazy feel for the ball and he gets a healthy edge through to Wade, who has to tumble to his left slightly
back of a length, angled away from off stump, defended off the back foot
full outside off stump, decent stride in but the timing on this cover drive has let it down. Toe-ends it wide of mid-off
length at off stump, drops it into the offside off the back foot

mistimed pull lands safely. This one is a tad short and angling away from Tamim who takes it on and gets it high on the bat. It clears mid-on but keeps him just about interested to his left, only to disappoint him in the end
good length, leg stump, flicked to long leg's right, back for the second
back of a length on the hips, glanced straight to long leg this time
line not found yet. Cummins bowls another full one on the pads, Kayes deflects it to long leg
good length, middle stump, puts in a nice stride and pushes this to mid-on
good length, off stump, defended with an open face to point
back of a length, off stump, nicely defended off the back foot
length ball angled across off stump, defended down the pitch
back of a length at the pads, tucked away to fine leg
good length, angled across off stump. Kayes goes hard at this. Swipes across the line, but the bat turns. Still gets two out of it as it beats square leg
good length, lulls him into poking at this outside off and beats his outside edge
back of a length, angled away from off stump, open face, down to third man
good length, off stump, solid forward block
back of a length outside off stump, pushed into the off side with soft hands
bit short, bit steep, but comfortably defended off the back foot
gets this to skid off a length, raps him on the thigh guard as he leaps to try and glance this, fine leg cleans up to his left
full at middle stump, puts in the stride, covers the angle, and uses his wrists to push this between square leg and mid-on
yum. Gets this bouncer to climb from a leg stump line and fly past the batsman's left shoulder. He's lucky that was too fast for him, the edge wasn't far away
mistimed drive on the up. This is angled away from off stump at a length, he closes the face on it and can't beat mid-on
back of a length at off stump, back foot defence onto his front boot
good length, middle stump, pushed on the up to short midwicket
mistimes another pull and gets away once more. This one is back of a length and he gets under it. It takes a glove and lobs gently in front of and to the right of Wade, whose dive can't beat gravity
back of a length at middle stump, short-arm jab, well controlled, a single through vacant square leg
back of a length outside off stump, thick outside edge on the dab, flies past the solitary slip, third man gets around
walks across his stumps to disturb the bowler's line, but he pushes it even further wide and gets this length ball to fizz past the outside edge
back of a length, pitches outside leg, smashes into the thigh guard. Cummins is getting help off the pitch, but the proper line has been elusive

soft. But once again, it's the pace off the pitch that beats Kayes. This is back of a length and a but wide outside off stump, but too quick for him to get on the back foot. Looks to clobber it on the up, but offers a simple catch to cover point
gets it to climb from back of a length, just outside off stump, Rahim arches backwards to let it go
good length, corridor, thick outside edge down to third man as he plays slightly inside the line
bouncer, too short, and down the leg side. Tamim ducks and accepts the extra
good length at off stump, big stride in to defend this
good length, angled away from off stump, left alone
good length, angled in at off stump, defended back down the pitch
good length, off stump, gets behind this for the front foot defence
back of a length, wide outside off stump. Looks to chop this behind square but gets it into the turf off the under edge
back of a length outside off stump, arches back, opens the face and fends this on the bounce past a diving slip
takes on the bouncer, too late on the hook. This was at his throat. Top edge lands well in front of fine leg
full and angled across off stump, Tamim successfully predicts the line and is promptly across with a shuffle. Steals a single wide of mid-on
back of a length, slightly outside off stump, watchfully left alone
good length at middle stump, looks to poke this into the off side, but can't close the face quickly enough. Gets it straight to mid-on
good bouncer, nicely directed at an off stump line, but Tamim has been there long enough to get under this and let it go
beats the outside edge. Cummins throws this a tad fuller and outside off stump, Tamim wants to cream this through the covers but is beaten for pace
back of a length, well wide of the marker outside off
throws his hands at another one outside off, and is beaten for pace once more. This time it's closer to him, he gets it off the toe to third man
full at middle stump, offers the full face as he drives this straight to mid-on
full, drifted in at off stump, gets to the pitch and pushes this to long-on
floated up at middle stump, flicked down to long-on
good length, pitches outside off and turns away a touch, nothing too difficult for Tamim who pokes this to point
good length, off stump, forward block
nice juicy full toss, this becomes, after Tamim goes down the track. But he's got the timing woefully wrong. Bat turns, Smith doesn't have to move at short midwicket to field this
good length, fired flat at off stump. Tamim steps out and isn't to the pitch this time. Gets his body behind it quickly and pushes it back down the pitch. 'I like him running,' screams Wade
back of a length in the corridor, open face to run it to third man
bouncer, too slow. Tamim is up quickly to get behind this and nails the pull shot, along the floor, straight to deep square leg
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
rush of blood. Back of a length outside off stump, Rahim is down the track to try and smash this over midwicket with a flat bat. Gets an inside edge that misses leg stump
short and a touch wide outside off, sliced aerially to third man
good length at middle stump, steps out and swipes across the line, toe-ends it to short midwicket
good length, flat, leg stump, tickled off the pads to fine leg
good length, middle stump, goes deep in the crease to defend it
stays deep in the crease, pulls this length ball from off stump, but can't beat Warner's dive at square leg
full at leg stump, clipped straight to short midwicket

walks across the stumps to try and paddle this from outside leg. It doesn't look like he got bat on that, but Wade wasn't close. This runs fine and the fielder has to run a long way to his right to cut it off, with a slide
good length at off stump, goes deep in the crease, drops it into the off side with soft hands
angling into the pads, a squeezed inside-edge down into the pitch
similar delivery, better result for Australia! Angled in towards middle and off, a scrambled seam, skids into the pads and up goes the finger. That was very plumb indeed
tight line to the left-hander, defended back down the pitch
too short, too wide, and that is utterly flogged, through backward square. Emphatic
tighter line, solid defence
tries to work one off the hip, but can't get it away
round the wicket, rising into a back-foot push into the covers
sliding in towards the off stump from round the wicket. 'Nice, Heady!' is the cry from behind the stumps. And it's true
tight angled line again, pushed into the off side
on the pads this time, but can't work it away
settles for the single with a push to long-off
this one grips, Tamim plays back and across to defend
a round-house pull, not connected
leaning onto the front foot, attempted push into the covers
very full length, swinging across the left-hander's bows. Punched to mid-off
too much width this time and that is scorched through the covers with an emphatic swing of the bat and a glorious followthrough. A good sliding stop on the rope to limit the damage
up on the toes, cut down to third man
good finish to the over. Straight and straighter. Nowhere to go but straight back down the line
squeezed out to point
full length, met right under the eyeline and punched into the covers
a bit more venom behind that drive, but short cover is well placed
hopping back and across and defended back to the bowler
driven off the back foot, straight to short cover
drilled into the covers, beats an enthusiastic dive. But this is a tidy, restrictive line from Head. No liberties being taken
a big stride down the wicket, and a punch through the line
ambitious flog from a static position. No real contact
a cross-batted tap into the covers
another drive into the off side, Australia doing well to limit the width on offer
short and straight, and Tamim hauls a pull in front of square, just out of reach of the close catcher and tidied up in the deep
good connection once again, meeting the short ball with a roll of the wrists to deep square leg
tidy line and length, a foot outside off, and tempting a flat-footed waft
good length once again, Tamim throws the bat into a drive, but inside-edges into his pads
battered into the covers, an emphatic stride on the front foot. But Smith at short cover has lightning hands
angled down to third man
more ambition in the drive, but no width to work with
cut hard and dropped at backward point! Maxwell wrings his hands as the ball flies into no-man's land, and the batsmen have to hurry to rush back for two! All happening!
swing from leg to off, angled defence into the off side
that is vast! Three strides down the pitch, like a Happy Gilmore tee-shot, and met with a thrilling, open-faced, lofted flog over the covers!
more fierce intent, as Tamim advances again, reminiscent of his battering of India in Trinidad a decade ago, as he hauls a pull through mid-on!
tucks the single to take the adrenalin out of the situation. Good batting
wristy drive, into the covers.
on the hip, swivelled round the corner. Now that's an over that's brought the crowd to life! Sixteen from it ...
big stride forward, pushed to cover
beats short cover with an open-faced steer
looped up onto the toes, pushed firmly to long-on, and there is Tamim's fifty. What a player he is
tight line on off stump. Defended watchfully from a neutral stance
pushed firmly to long-off
gave himself room, and Head opted for tails, spearing the ball into his toes to complete a good, restrictive over
punched into the off side
defended to cover
short and sharp, into the body. Tucked to short leg
tighter line
rolls the wrists on a handsome drive into the covers
lifting delivery into the hip, pops up and lands safely
tapped into the off side
up on the toes, poked out to point
another calm single into the covers
a bit of width and Tamim climbs into a drive, but short cover is well placed
worked off the toes, and has to scurry back into the crease as Wade makes good ground from behind the stumps to field
a wide and low full-toss and put away smartly. Reaching out to steer a loose delivery through backward point
forward and pushed to the off side
short and cut again, to bring up the hundred as the point sweeper gathers
pushed into the off side
on the back foot, tapped to the off side, and excellent communication on the quick single
banged in short, and Tamim hops into line well to defend
back and across, attempted cut
into the toes, a round-house waft into the leg side. That's the fifty stand
advances down the track, and drilled into the off side. Looked more emphatic than it was, but another single all the same
flicked to leg, decent momentum building here
another half-hearted charge, and a dab through third man
hustled through, chopped to the off side
galloping down the track, and a very sharp bouncer sends Tamim into his shell. Good riposte to pre-meditated aggression
hangs back in the crease this time, and nudges to leg
tapped to third man
tucked into the leg-side, wears it on the gloves as he does so
caught on the crease a touch with a good hostile full length
angled out to third man, but gathered at backward point
well now, that's dented his figures a touch! Or by 25% in fact, down the track, lambasted over the off side and plops over the rope!
hello, massive! Tamim comes charging, he's got the measure of Head's length now, and this goes miles back into the stands at long off!
dabbed to the off side
Head needs beheading, is Tamim's attitude, but his massive wipe over the covers doesn't connect this time, and falls just short of the sweeper
Massive appeal, and up goes the finger! An instant review though from Shakib ... He was a long way forward, but it's given as umpire's call on impact, and the decision stays out!
down on one knee, and flipped over the shoulder to get Sabbir up and running
outside off, angled bat through third man
forward and defended
tight line on off stump, squirted to backward point where Maxwell dives over the ball to gift a single
round the wicket, attacking the ribs. Tamim hops inside the line and settles for the single to square leg
odd non-shot. Rather aborted his forward defence, and Smith is tempted to review as the ball raps the pads. Probably going over, on balance
short and quick, Sabbir rides the bounce and defends to gully
Tamim on the stampede down the track, an under-edged swivel-pull, and Wade does well to get a palm on a stretching defence
tight line, zips through a loose waft
down the track and punched to mid-off
up on the toes, attacking the ribs. Good aggression, deflected to the leg side
forward and blocked down the pitch
back of a length, doesn't get up much as Tamim attempts a loose wafty leg-glance
round the wicket, squeezed down into the pitch
that's tremendous, aggressive line into the ribs, but Tamim topples inside the line, takes the leg gully out of the equation with a sweetly struck pull over backward square
more aggression from Tamim, advancing down the pitch, but no real contact
slower ball, Tamim slides across his stumps to pilfer a single through third man
good firm strike off the back foot, out through the covers
width, can't connect, maybe a touch lucky not to be called wide
tight line, under the nose, worked to point off the back foot
spanked down the track as Tamim advances and almost hauls himself off his feet with a round-house wallop. But mid-on slides to intercept
a spliced pull, and he gets away with it! Plops in no-man's land at short midwicket, perfectly bissecting two fielders
on the back foot, wafted down to third man
full length, angled across the crease, and a quick single to the leg side
banged in short, pulled fine, but gets away with a rare poor ball as fine leg gathers
drifted in full at leg stump, gives him the charge and yorks himself. Jams it back to the bowler
he strikes! Generously tossed up, full and wide. Sabbir has gotten out to better spin bowling than this. Gets to the pitch and drills the cover drive straight to Smith at extra cover
full and fast at the toes, feebly poked into the leg side
googly, keeps low from a length, makes him hurry down the leg side to push this to extra cover
drift, good length, slight jump upwards as he turns this, outside half defence from the batsman
good length, middle stump, forward block back to the bowler
good length, sharp drift into a good length outside off, takes the outside edge after turning as Tamim pokes at this. Single to short third's right
gets low and makes this a full toss, then ramps it to fine leg from an off stump line
good length at off stump, driven on the up to long-off
flighted at leg stump on a good length, Mahmudullah meets it at the pitch after galloping down the track and hammers this flat over the long-on boundary
this one slides through with the angle and beats his outside edge as he looks to defend off the front foot
good length at middle stump, backs away to make room, but bunts it straight to short third man
tossed up at leg stump, Tamim leans into it and clips to deep square
low full toss at leg stump, pushed through fast, tapped to long-off with an open face
full at middle stump, pushes it to midwicket after reaching the pitch
good length at middle stump, goes on the back foot and tucks this into the open leg side
looks to sweep, misses and looks to be hit in front. Loud appeal is turned down. Pitching outside leg?

doesn't matter if that was out last ball, he's gifted him a wicket next ball. This is pushed through quick, back of a length and keeps a tad low. Mahmudullah makes room and looks to slap this through the off side, is only successful in chopping it onto the leg stump
short and angled wide of off stump, dabs it to third man
good length, speared in at off stump, but the teenager gets nicely behind this to defend off the front foot
nearly hits this bouncer down fine leg's throat. He's not a very tall man, so he got under this easily, but there was no control on that hook. Lands in front of the fielder
slower bouncer at the chest, gets his front leg up to maintain his balance as he pulls this nicely between deep square and deep midwicket
back of a length at middle stump, whipped off the back foot to deep midwicket

yikes, he had no clue there. This one climbed sharply from back of a length and was headed for his rib cage. He takes his eyes off the ball, one hand off the bat and fends at this to get it down to fine leg
dropped short at off stump, chopped straight to backward point
good length, floated up at middle stump, flicked straight to midwicket
back of a length at middle stump, gets deep in the crease and whips this nicely to long-on
good length at leg stump, leans in, drops it in front of short fine
good shot. This skids on from a good length, but he gets the bat down quickly after going back in the crease. Dragged nicely past fine leg with a pull
quicker one, fired in at leg stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length at leg stump, gets that front leg barrier up again, then whips it wide of long leg
good length at middle stump, watches it onto the bat and uses his wrists to tap this to midwicket
good length at off stump, plays this late, defends it under his eyes
back of a length outside off stump, slices it to third man with a flourish
short ball, leg stump, jumps inside the line and controls the hook shot, single to long leg
uses the angle, picks this off this hips, gets it to fine leg for a single
full and fired at off stump from around the wicket, no feet, reaches out and skews it to point on the up
good length at off stump, gets behind the line and pushes it to point's right
back of a length in the corridor, climbs sharply but so does Tamim. Gets behind it and opens the face, but backward point dives to his right to stop a single
nice. Picks the slower ball, watches it rise off a length and opens the face at the last moment to run this past Wade
full and fired well down the leg side, Wade leaps low to his right
back of a length at the hips, glanced wide of long leg
low full toss, swerves away after angling in at off stump, thick outside edge down to third man
floated up at off stump, driven to extra cover
back of a length at off stump, tries to run it fine of short third, can't get it past
length outside off stump, pushed out to sweeper cover
googly, slides through at ankle height from a good length, deflects it to short third
goes low and stretches out to paddle this good length ball from well outside off, a jog to the right for long leg
goes for the sweep, this time it's too full outside off. Beats him

oh no, that's an unfortunate end to a good innings. It's that trademark one-legged whip again, but this time he closes the face too early. Wasn't a particularly menacing ball from Starc, short and at leg stump. The top edge carried neatly to long leg
there it is, the yorker. But slightly wide of off stump. It had gone past the outside edge of both bat and off stump before Mortaza knew what was happening
ta-dah! Full, fast, straight, and it's that sweet sound of the stumps being disturbed that Mortaza has probably grown up loving. But he's the batsman today

thanks for coming. Rubel appears to be shuddering before Starc releases the ball. Exposes the stumps and is met, predictably, by a full straight ball. Ambitious opening of the face brings him no result
how on earth?! This yorker swings in viciously and has no answer from the batsman. Miraculously, it bisects the inside edge and the off stump and sneaks through to Wade
this is deadly from Starc. Proper movement into the batsman to rap him on the front pad, he didn't know a lot about it
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot into the off side
good length, angled in at off stump, solidly behind it to defend
backs away, gets followed by a bouncer, and the result is an under-edge as he looks to pull
backs away again, this time he gets a yorker at middle stump. Toe-ends the drive to mid-off
bouncer at middle stump, flies past the attempted pull and forces Wade to leap to complete the take
hostile. Short ball in the corridor, steep bounce and it beats his outside edge as he looks to dab this to take a single. Won't retain the strike
backs away, watches it swing in from outside off stump from a length, shows all the stumps and leaves the most brave leave ever left

loud cheers as he gets bat on this and squeezes it past point. Don't be fooled, he didn't know much about this either. Backed away, stretched out and threw his bat at out at this and backward point got a bad bounce
aaaaaaaand done. Starc has 4 off 9 balls. This is slightly short of being overpitched, but it tails away from Mehedi a touch. He wants to thump it on the up through the off side, but that's too quick
nice line to launch the innings, fading into the left hander and ghosting past the edge
Warner feels forward, on the front foot. A tiny bit of away movement to complicate the stroke
on the hip, jabbed firmly to square leg
attacking the base of off stump, blocked back down the wicket
tickled off the pads to get the innings up and away, and the ball slowed up so perfectly inside the rope that they were able to run and run for four
up on the toes, sweetly punched to the brink of the rope at deep extra cover. Placement to the fore from the pugnacious Warner. The power can wait in these conditions
tip and run, and a fumble at midwicket from Imrul Kayes saves Finch from a stone-dead run-out chance! Careful now...
stands tall in defence, blotted back down the pitch
up on the toes, defended once again
a tiny hint of movement off the deck, lots of excitement behind the stumps but safe enough
reaching forward, squeezed to point
deep back in the crease, chipped to midwicket, and that is a tidy over
sliding down the leg side, can't quite get it away
slower delivery, deviously bowled
a touch too much width this time, and handsomely slammed through point for four. The crowd goes earpoppingly quiet
tighter line this time, and solidly blocked
yee-har! Finch decides this one needs to go, and he's climbing into an air-shot golf swing to nothing outside off
slower ball again, defended on the back foot into the covers
on the pads, clipped to square leg
on the pads, that's a freebie, through fine leg
holds this one back on a middle-and-off line. Blocked
well bowled, hitting the pitch hard outside off stump, and defended on the back foot
clipped off the toes, gentle accumulation through the leg side
tight line on the pads, the ball bobbles off an inside-edge, down into the pitch, and they scamper the single
taking it easy
another deflection into the gap, another quick single
not remotely where he was aiming it, but effective all the same, under-edged pull through fine leg
very full, right under the nose as Warner leans forward to defend. A loud 'no!'
good delivery, nibbling through to the keeper
angled defence, down to third man. Bangladesh need to make something happen. Ideally of the rainy variety
a well-judged single, patted straight back past the bowler, off the back foot
that's a bit ropey, too soft and no pace on the ball whatsoever. Flipped round the corner with insoucience
soft hands, controlling the pace of the ball and pinching the single as mid-off gallops in
outside off, dabbed to third man
round the wicket, steered to the leg side. Easy peasy
sliding down the leg side, looked to have flicked the pad but the umpire was having none of it
pushed on the up, into the covers
tremendously cunning delivery, gripping on the surface as it wriggles through to the keeper
an inside-out baseball slam through square leg, looking for the slower ball and hanging the consequences. Well fielded
soft hands once again, into the covers
on the pads, another easy single into the leg side
slower ball again, well watched and defended on the back foot to cover
outside off, and a huge cheer for a crowd catch at short cover
worked into the leg side
good wicket-to-wicket delivery, defended on the back foot
hoisted high and handsome through square leg. Too short, too easy for Finch, who just lifts it on its way
keeps low, and up goes the finger! Pinned on the back pad, was smashing into leg, and Bangladesh have their breakthrough!
full, angled into the pads and Smith's shuffle makes this an easy flick for him, square leg gives chase
zing! A yorker first up to Smith, straight at his toes. Has him hopping to dig this out, but he does it
slower ball, full at middle stump, watchfully pushed to mid-off on the up

this would've been straight to cover point...if there was a cover point there. But Mustafiz has catchers on the leg side. Smith doesn't even need to try to keep this cover drive down, although with that field, he shouldn't be bowling overpitched and wide

low full toss, wide outside off stump, looks at his preferred destination too early as he looks to slash it through the covers. It's an inside edge that runs past the non-striker and between mid-off and mid-on
back of a length at middle stump, pushed into the leg side off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
full outside off stump, leans in and almost starts running before he's connected this push to mid-off
good length, tailing in at middle stump. A shuffle across to tap this to deep square leg
back of a length at off stump, defended into the covers off the back foot
140 kph, back of a length, skids through the corridor from under his attempted pull shot
good length, slanted across the left-hander, he slashes and misses
good length at leg stump, watchfully pushes it wide of mid-on to take a single
tossed up outside off stump, leans into the drive, finds sweeper cover
back of a length, slight turn into off stump, solidly behind this to punch it to long-on off the back foot
back of a length outside off stump, chopped to sweeper cover off the back foot
good length, leg stump, tucked to deep square leg
nice. Good length, off stump, slight turn, the perfect offbreak. Met by the perfect forward defence
full and wide outside off stump, driven hard, straight to cover
good length, in the corridor, climbs on Smith who fends at it and takes the inside edge...which rolls rather quickly to Mustafizur's right at fine leg. He gets there though
overpitched outside off stump, looks for the cover drive, bat turns and it dribbles past the non-strikers stumps
offcutter, good length, outside off stump. Makes Warner lean into this and beats the outside edge
slower ball, back of a length outside off stump. Wants to cut, but he's made to wait too much. Drags it out to sweeper cover
back of a length at off stump, hops across to cover the line, tucks it to fine leg
good length, off stump, happy to wait for this to come on and open the face, taking this easy
good length, leg stump, tickled off his pads to fine leg...and he runs, oh, so fast to come back for the second
good length, angling away outside off stump, Warner times his forward defence so well, it bounces over point and that's two more for him
back of a length at leg stump, shovelled off his thigh to deep square
bouncer at middle stump, Smith quickly behind to place this hook shot to deep square's right, forces him to dive and he does well
back of a length outside off stump, punched to sweeper cover
back of a length in the corridor, Warner looks to swat this through midwicket, it comes on too quickly. A feeble trickle to mid-on
offcutter, full at off stump, drags this drive to midwicket
good length, angled in at off stump, Smith gets behind it and pokes it past Warner with a full face. Calls nice and loud, steals a single
good length at off stump, forward defence into the covers
back of a length on the pads, gets deep and tucks it behind square on the leg side to become the fastest Aussie to 4,000 ODI runs
good length at middle stump, waits for it to arrive, then flicks his wrists on it to pinch a single through midwicket
offcutter at a good length, he walks across - obviously - and turns this around to fine leg
good length, quick and swinging in at off stump, nicely timed back foot defence nearly beats point, but he dives to his left
back of a length outside off stump, comes on nicely, punched to sweeper cover
oooh close! Rubel's got some strength in that shoulder. Bangs this in back of a length outside off, gets it to skid rapidly in and go past Warner's edge
another one slides off rapidly, this is fuller, and strikes him on the pads as he looks to flick this
and another. Serious pace off the pitch. Cummins is the only other one who has done this today. Gets this to spit at Warner from back of a length, hits him high on the bat as he defends it
back of a length outside off, goes for the pull, is too late on it. Bunts it off the inside edge into the leg side. Rubel too quick for Warner at the moment
offcutter, full outside off stump, looks to drive this through the covers, inside half of the bat, rolls down to long-on
good length, angled in at off stump, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
good length at off stump, forward defence to extra cover...who shies at the non-strikers to take away a few more seconds
good length at off stump, defended back down the pitch. Expect this henceforth. It's the quickest way to get the ball back to the bowler
good length at off stump, defends it to point who hangs on to it for a bit, then throws it to the keeper
full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
